    • Method Detail

      • createFilteredQuery

        public static <T> javax.persistence.TypedQuery<T> createFilteredQuery(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                                      @NotNull(value="EntityManager can\'t be null")
                                                                      @NotNull(value="EntityManager can\'t be null") javax.persistence.EntityManager entityManager,
                                                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> queryParams)
        Create a TypedQuery filtered with the parameters sent in the map. In the case that one of the parameters is not recognized, it will be omitted.
        The structure of the map is as follows:
        • key: name of the attribute as it is in the entity.
        • value: object with the value to be compared.
        Type Parameters:
        T - class of the consulted entity
        Parameters:
        clazz - class of the consulted entity
        entityManager - entity manager
        queryParams - parameter to make the filter
        Returns:
        query with applied filters
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if EntityManager is null

      • filter

        @NotNull
private static <T> @NotNull javax.persistence.criteria.Predicate[] filter(javax.persistence.criteria.Root<T> from,
                                                                                    javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaBuilder builder,
                                                                                    @NotNull(value="Query params can\'t be null")
                                                                                    @NotNull(value="Query params can\'t be null") java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> queryParams)
        Applies the filters sent to the query.
        Type Parameters:
        T - entity type
        Parameters:
        from - entity reference
        builder - object used to build the query
        queryParams - parameters for the filter
        Returns:
        fix with filters
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if queryParams is null
